Posted By: rollinsclone (4/24/2013 10:51:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What I like about him is that he can be countered.   
  
Yet he's still good.   
  
Uncounterability, Hexproof, and Indestructibility are tricky mechanics to make actually fun. You really don't want to be using them much. I understand for a while Uncounterable was really the only thing that Blue had to care about, but that's different now. There are other ways to hose Blue that are just as effective.   
  
I mean, I DO want them to keep making Uncounterable stuff. I just don't want 'every single anti-Blue card needs to have 'can't be countered'. The Rare cycle this Block was a fun exception to normalcy, but I'd like to see cards like Ruric that punish in ironically 'subtle' ways more. :)   
  
When 6 damage to the face is called 'subtle', you know the thing it's being compared to might be a slight bit O.P. :P -\_-
posts.html:
What I like about him is that he can be countered.

Yet he's still good.

Uncounterability, Hexproof, and Indestructibility are tricky mechanics to make actually fun. You really don't want to be using them much. I understand for a while Uncounterable was really the only thing that Blue had to care about, but that's different now. There are other ways to hose Blue that are just as effective.

I mean, I DO want them to keep making Uncounterable stuff. I just don't want 'every single anti-Blue card needs to have 'can't be countered'. The Rare cycle this Block was a fun exception to normalcy, but I'd like to see cards like Ruric that punish in ironically 'subtle' ways more. :)

When 6 damage to the face is called 'subtle', you know the thing it's being compared to might be a slight bit O.P. :P -_-

Posted By: Continue (4/23/2013 5:48:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My favorite of the maze runners! He (they?) feels the most like a unique card, with interesting ability combinations (Vigilance *and* reach?) and a punisher for spellcasters. Short of being countered, creature'd (e.g. [Shriekmaw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shriekmaw)) or ability'd (e.g. [Avatar of Woe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avatar of Woe)), he's going to get at least 6 damage in.  
If you don't like it that he attacks every turn, why not make a hyperaggressive deck that forces everyone to attack? [Fires of Yavimaya](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fires of Yavimaya), [Avatar of Slaughter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avatar of Slaughter), [Fumiko the Lowblood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fumiko the Lowblood), [Kazuul, Tyrant of the Cliffs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kazuul, Tyrant of the Cliffs)...
posts.html:
My favorite of the maze runners! He (they?) feels the most like a unique card, with interesting ability combinations (Vigilance and reach?) and a punisher for spellcasters. Short of being countered, creature'd (e.g. Shriekmaw) or ability'd (e.g. Avatar of Woe), he's going to get at least 6 damage in.
If you don't like it that he attacks every turn, why not make a hyperaggressive deck that forces everyone to attack? Fires of Yavimaya, Avatar of Slaughter, Fumiko the Lowblood, Kazuul, Tyrant of the Cliffs...

posts.post_content:
A nice, solid R/G commander that has been really lacking. It's not much of a build-around general (although you will have a lot of creatures as opposed to spells), but it gives use a nice red/green aggro commander.  
  
The only thing weird about him to me is the vigilance (and that he's an ogre with reach), but I still really like him. He's a nice solid Timmy card.
posts.html:
A nice, solid R/G commander that has been really lacking. It's not much of a build-around general (although you will have a lot of creatures as opposed to spells), but it gives use a nice red/green aggro commander.

The only thing weird about him to me is the vigilance (and that he's an ogre with reach), but I still really like him. He's a nice solid Timmy card.

posts.post_content:
I just got a shiny Ruric Thar in a pack that also contained a [Melek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Melek). I think the multiverse is trying to tell me something, I'm just not sure what.  
  
Had this guy been uncounterable (By the way, am I the only one who thinks that there need to be a keyword for that?), I think he would've been a tad too overpowered/anti-blue, especially for something that's only a rare.  
  
That aside, he's still a very good card, and a great addition to any deck running Gruul colors that's out to stick it to players who love their noncreature spells like no other. (Especially blue.) Even though they hate each other, he has surprisingly good utility uses with [Borborygmos Enraged](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Borborygmos Enraged); use all those creatures with Bloodrush to beef up your heavy hitters without Ruric biting you in the ass for it while BoBo uses all those extra lands as improvised [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)s. You can also pair him with [Garuuk's Pack Leader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garuuk's Pack Leader) and, as long as you'r... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
